Properties

View Source

Helper

Gets or sets whether the site is a helper site.

Declaration
public bool Helper { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Boolean
Remarks

A remote site may be a helper site when the local site first joins the replication group. Once the local site has been established as a member of the group, this config setting is ignored.

View Source

Host

The host of the site.

Declaration
public string Host { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.String
View Source

Legacy

Whether the site is within a legacy group.

Declaration
public bool Legacy { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Boolean
Remarks

Specify the site in a legacy group. It would be considered as part of an existing group, upgrading from a previous version of Berkeley DB. All sites in the legacy group must specify this for themselves (the local site) and for all other sites initially in the group.

View Source

Gets or sets whether the site is the local one.

Declaration
public bool LocalSite { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Boolean
View Source

Peer

Gets or sets whether the site is peer to local site.

Declaration
public bool Peer { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Boolean
Remarks

A peer site may be used as a target for "client-to-client" synchronization messages. It only makes sense to specify this for a remote site.

View Source

Port

The port of the site.

Declaration
public uint Port { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.UInt32
View Source

SiteCreator

Gets or sets whether the site is a group creator.

Declaration
public bool SiteCreator { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Boolean

False
Remarks

Only the local site could be applied as a group creator. The group creator would create the initial membership database, defining a replication group of just the one site, rather than trying to join an existing group when it starts for the first time.
